Special points: pickled ginger is homemade and delicious. Truffle is freshly shaved. Favorite dishes: Himalayan Trout, hamachi truffle, toro, maguro
author: Jessica P.

description: Didn't wait because we got there right before they open...small place, decent food. Very fresh fish... everything we ordered is delicious.
author: Yao Y.

description:
TL;DR - I'm a sucker for cute interiors and that was the best part of this restaurant. 

I thought it was a nice gesture to start off the meal with the walu carpaccio as an amuse bouche. The fish was a bit underwhelming and as much as I love truffle, I always questions truffle oil because not all truffle oils are made with real truffle.

Anywho. I only really wanted to try elephant sushi for the beasti boys nigiri. (ankimo, quail egg yolk and uni) The camera loved it, but it was bland at best. There was NO seasoning (and as much as I love uni, egg yolk and ankimo; there was just nothing to balance out the creaminess of each element)

Not wanting to leave on an empty stomach, I also ended up getting the sashimi bowl #1? Meh. Again, underwhelming and no seasoning... Wanna know why omakase is amazing? Yes, the quality of fish is better, but mostly, everything is seasoned. But.... thats what I really got with the sashimi bowl and the nigiri :/

Hard pass. At these prices, you're better off paying a little more for fresher, tastier, well balanced sushi.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
Went on a Wednesday night at 8pm and the wait was only about 15-20 minutes!

Got the sashimi bowl spicy trio, the white out roll (hamachi, avocado, seared butterfish), and the double albacore roll (white tuna, avocado, honey mustard). The spicy sashimi bowl was BOMBB! :) super fresh and tasty. The white out roll was good too, however, I really didn't like the double albacore roll at all. The honey mustard in the roll really threw it off - a condiment that's used on chicken strips should NOT be used in a sushi roll... it would have tasted much better if they just kept the traditional Japanese flavors. 

The menu is not extensive, and I actually had a lot of trouble finding any rolls that really appealed to me, but the sashimi spicy bowl is A+!!
author: Sophia L.

description: I've had a lot of sushi, but this was the best I've had!  The White Out was especially delicious and surprising.  Will be coming back next time in SF!
author: David K.

description:
Highly, highly recommend. There's a sign in at the door but you can call ahead to put your name down. It's great that you can put your name and number down and then leave until they call you (unfortunately no waiting area and the area outside is not very nice). Since it's so small, I would recommend going with a party of 2-3 in order to get seated. Honestly their service is so quick I would say the wait is probably only 20-30 minutes. This is now my #1 sushi spot in the city after years of searching for an affordable and delicious place! 

Ambiance: Very small (12 seats only) and intimate but honestly feels like Japan plus you get to see them make the sushi right in front of you!
Service: Super fast and friendly
Food: INCREDIBLE. We ordered:
White Out Roll: After the first bite I was speechless. I honestly didn't have super high expectations for this place but I was shocked at how fresh and flavorful the fish was! (~$16?)
Sashimi bowl #2: Tuna, yellowtail and avocado! I added some wasabi and soy sauce for additional flavor but I think the rice comes flavored already. Very large portions with plenty of fresh fish and rice! ($18)
Sashimi bowl spicy trio: My friend ordered this but I tried a bite and thought it was really good except definitely pretty spicy! ($18)
author: Taryn Q.

description:
The wait is crazy long. The seats are not really comfortable.
But the food is amazing!!
Get the Himalayan trout!
Do not get the number 1, number 2, number 3, they are good but boring. Go for the amazing first page offerings.
author: Alex N.

description: Amazing unique sushi. I had the YA Man roll it was delicious. I cannot reccomend this place enough. Seating is sparce but 100% worth the wait if you must!
author: Alex U.

description:
This is by far my favorite sushi place in the city. The quality and freshness of their fish cannot be. Best. I love ordering the sushi bowls, specifically the one with seared butter fish! The chef normally gives you a quick taste of fish to get your dinner started. 

I highly recommend anything with butter fish or the mussel shooters.
author: Sarah P.

description: love their sashimi and flaming sushi. It's noisy not good for conversation.
author: Grace T.

description:
This must be a perfect place to work for. The atmosphere is perfect, a little quiet corner of the city, small but in a unique way. Thus, it only opens for 3 hours...must be awesome hours for those who work there (perhaps).
From the review, I was afraid that it may be a long line. Luckily, it was raining and I came at 9.00pm so no line and super quiet.
+Food: medium (to me). I was hungry so I ended up order rolls more than sashimi. I should have done otherwise. Their sashimi was fresh and tasty. The rolls were neat, and delicious. But nothing too special or wow. 
+Service: my waiter was supa kute, and attentive. Probably there wasn't many of us. He was around my spot many times taking care of dishes, water and everything else. Really please.
I will definitely come back
author: Bao V.

description: Loved this place! Selection of fish was fresh and delicious! Love the hamachi truffle and Himalayan trout. Besides the amazing food the service was superb, we brought our own bottle of wine (corkage fee was 15.00). Restaurant itself is small but intimate, perffff spot for a date night ;)
author: Maxine T.

description:
Favorite sushi in SF that I've experienced thus far. At first my boyfriend and I were skeptical of a menu that featured all Japanese/Hawaiian fusion rolls. We were afraid it would stray too much from the classic sushi experience we love so much. But let me tell you- this place is on another level. 

When you go you MUST try the Ya Man roll. It's a hot roll with white fish that will blow your socks off. The flavors fill every corner of your mouth. The warmth is a pleasant and welcome surprise. Highly recommend. We ordered several other rolls and we're not disappointed by any of them. Amazing flavors all around.

Down side? This place is tiny. It has 12 seats at a bar and is usually crazy busy during dinner hours especially on the weekends (like 1 hour + wait busy). However we've found that before 6pm is usually just a 30 min wait. Going between 7-8pm? Forget about it. We tried to go again last night at 7:15 and they couldn't even put us on the list for the night because the waitlist was so full. 

Another pro tip: the Elephant Sushi on Hyde is nowhere near as good!!! Please be advised! Just decent restaurant sushi, nothing extraordinary. But the 12-seater on Geary is the REAL DEAL.
author: Tamara S.

description:
First off - $$ is a lie. Dishes average $20/each and you need between 5-7 for two people. 

Second - customer service not only does not exist, but they have the balls to provide 3 tips levels on the bill - 20%, 25%, 30%. Just plain obnoxious. The place is overpriced as is. 

Fish - Some dishes were very tasty -- trout! Others not so much: Hamachi Truffle was overpowered with fired onions, all I tasted were onions. The double albacore roll is just a ball of mush. No texture, no crunch, just mush. 

Yet another overpriced establishment for all the over paid folk who don't know much about good food.
author: Howard G.

description: Super nice and friendly service.  Sushi tastes amazing!  -1 star because the space was so cramped you were pretty much elbowing the people next to you while you eat.  And definitely lacked enough counter space to place all the dishes.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
Delicious! Upon reading reviews, we made sure to get there early. We arrived at 5:50 and there were already people ahead of us in line. (They have 12 seats total).
We were greeted by a free sample of white fish in truffle oil. It was good but I don't love truffle oil.  
We ordered the spicy tuna, white out roll, ya man roll and yummy pockets. The spicy tuna was quite possibly the best I've ever had. Very spicy but delicious. The white out roll was my least favorite. It was still good but maybe the least flavorful. The Ya Man was very good, the salmon melts in your mouth! And the Yummy Pockets were a little difficult to eat but totally worth it.
We sat in the corner seats and had a great view of the sushi chefs!
author: Mary Kate D.

description:
Waited 45 minutes, had moderate expectations based on yelp reviews..

The restaurant is tiny.  When you sit down at the bar you barely have enough room to eat your food and let alone your arms.  Body heat from your co-patrons keep you warm.  

An added bonus is that the place was warm, humid and smelled like armpit.  I should have heeded the warning, because the food tasted the same.

Ordered the "hamachi truffle".  Ok so the fish was warm and wasn't fresh, and it doesn't come with truffle..  When I asked the waitress, "We ran out of truffle over a month ago"

Hmm well maybe you should have told me that before I ordered..  or rename it to "hamachi". 

So ok no truffle on my "hamachi truffle". so is it cheaper?   "No the chef adds the truffle for free".   

Sure that makes sense 

Tried the toro sushi. It was more like regular tuna. And it had lots of veins and was fishy. 

Great job
author: Ted C.

description:
4.5 stars! Get the creative appetizers but skip the nigiri/rolls. The rice is cold and hard. 

Elephant opens at 6:00pm and we arrived at 5:50pm to be second in line. The entire place seats around 10-12 but you can put your name down if you miss the first seating! Service is very fast and don't be shy about waving down a waiter. 

We ordered:

Walu Carpaccio (Free) -- 5 stars 
Props for starting off the meal right! You can easily taste the truffle without it overwhelming the light sweetness of the butter fish. 

Mussel shooters -- 5 stars 
Six large shells filled with fresh mussels, quail egg, roe, and ponzu. I loved the texture of the mussels and how bright it tasted. Must try if you like shellfish! 

Beastie -- 5 stars 
Two pieces of uni nigiri with ankimo, quail egg, and shiso leaf. The shiso added a minty taste that cuts the richness of the uni and the liver. 

Himalayan trout -- 4 stars 
Fresh trout sashimi on top of a block of pink Himalayan salt. No extra soy sauce needed. Side note, do you think they reuse that block? Because I might've tried licking it. 

Yummy pocket -- 5 stars 
I highly highly recommend this! It's $6 for two pieces of inari (sweet tofu skin) stuffed with rice and spicy scallops. So so so good! 

Ankimo nigiri and scallop nigiri -- 3 stars 
Hard rice and small slices. I'm not sure if they make the ankimo in house, but it's below average... 

White out roll -- 3.5 stars 
It's good but nothing spectacular. Butter fish on top of hamachi.

Total price + beer for 2: $120
author: Xinxin W.

description:
It's been a week since i've been and i'm still thinking about it. Searched yelp for sushi close to our hotel room and this place was a few blocks away with the most stars.
So happy we went here and can't wait to go back when i'm back in San Francisco. We waited about 30 min (there are only about 10 seats at a small sushi bar).
Once we were seated we were given a sample of the butter fish and it was delicious. 
Service was friendly and the waitresses were attentive. 
Everything tasted really fresh and the New Zealand ocean trout on the Himalayan salt rock was the best.
author: Pica L.

description: Putting low quality truffle oil on sashimi is a horrible idea. Finding on my CC statement that they put more tip than I signed for is theft. Not going back. Spare yourself this experience.
author: Winter M.

description:
I love elephant sushi! Our arrival here was rather serendipitous, as we were trying to eat at mensho ramen but the line was completely out of control, so we continued down the block and found this little sushi bar. We arrived 20 mins before opening , and there was already a line formed. I found this very promising. The doors opened promptly at 6, and we were lucky to be in the top 15 to be seated. The small bar only seats about 10-15 ppl total at a time. Plus, the line continued to grow as we were ordering and eating.  I'm guessing bc they are fairly new, we got a complimentary appetizer- the butterfish with ponzu. It was my first time trying butterfish raw, and I loved it. That prompted us to order a few extra butterfish items- so good job elephant sushi  for sucking us in!! The three of us shared 6 items, and each was as delicious as the last. My favorites were the raw butterfish and the white out roll. 

I think this little sushi bar will do very well. I enjoyed eating here and would definitely revisit when I am back in town!
author: Lianna N.

description:
This is the best sushi I've ever had, bar none. I know this sounds hyperbolic, but I resurrected a long dead Yelp account specifically to give my kudos to Elephant. In all honestly, I'm a selfish bastard and therefore almost wary of posting this just because I don't want Elephant to become TOO successful and leave me waiting down at Whiskey Thieves for hours waiting my name to be called. But always give credit where credit is due, and it is absolutely due here.

The butterfish carpaccio was especially out of this world, same with the Giants roll. The cooks were legit and businesslike in the application of their art, and the servers were both sweet and attentive. (And a word for the wise, put your name on the list and leave your phone number and they will when your spot is ready.)
author: Jack L.

description:
Oh man.. Where do I begin? Every item was delicious. 

Let's start off by saying this location only seats 10-12 people so the earlier you go, the easier it is to get seated. The smaller your party is, the shorter your wait is. 

We were given Walu Carpaccio on the house. Butterfish topped with truffle oil melted in your mouth. Yum! 

Himalayan trout served on a salt block - salt block was the real MVP because you didn't have to dip this into any soy sauce. Just eat it straight off the block!

Other notable mentions were spicy hamachi, Giants roll, and red and yellow roll. You barely taste the tomato in the Giants roll and it left a slightly sweet and juicy aftertaste. I don't like tomatoes and this was a good roll. Also, the mango from the red and yellow roll wasn't overpowering. Some sushi restaurants do too much with that. This also left a refreshing after taste. I recommend this as your last item to clean your palate. 

All in all, I enjoyed this place very much. Gotta go back for that Himalayan trout!
author: Linda N.

description:
The new outpost of Elephant Sushi arrived recently as somewhat of an attractive nuisance: a small, trendy, and frequently lauded tiny local spot pitched perfectly--a little too perfectly--for San Francisco and its tired, rapidly gentrifying 'Loin. Clean lines, exposed wood and pipe, and mostly standard sushi options dressed up with foodie accoutrements like truffle oil and runny eggs.

And yet it all worked. The $14 sashimi bowls are a better deal than most comparable lunch options available in the city. The White Out roll in its ponzu'd glory jumped right to the top echelon of rolls I'll seek out in the city. And after seeing it choked full with a line of folks waiting for weeks, a strategic call 45 minutes in advance sufficed to get in the door with practically no wait--perhaps I have the Mensho Ramen people down the street to thank. Attentive service, an attractive setting, beautiful ingredients and presentation, and they don't even gouge folks for drinks. The total bill came to around $75 for two and we both ate more than our fill--better than can often be done at sushi joints in the neighborhood with a lot less to offer in the way of style and creativity. In one meal it went from a neighborhood curiosity to a roster entry I hope to frequent as long as I'm in the neighborhood. Good show.
author: James D.

description:
There are now three Elephant Sushi locations. The original one on Hyde, the lunch-only one at Golden Gate, and now this one, on Geary. I have refused to go to the Hyde location because I dislike that they don't take reservations and the wait can take up to 2 hours on a first-come first serve basis. We eagerly came to the Geary location when we heard that they recently opened less than 2 months ago!

The nigiri and sashimi here are both excellent. Extremely high quality fish! They are a bar-only restaurant with 10-12 seats. They also do not take formal reservations - get here at 5:45-6PM when they open, put your name and phone # (write both very clearly) on the list, and they will call you with an ETA. We were the second on the list and they called me at 6:30PM promptly letting us know that our seats would be ready within 5 minutes.

Got there right at 6:35 and got seated right away and were given a complimentary amuse bouche of their Walu - pretty nice gesture!

Since Elephant Sushi is more fusion-y than other traditional sushi bars (Omakase, An, Kusakabe, Sushi Yoshizumi), the style reminds me a lot of Akiko's and Pabu's. They have authentic nigiri and sashimi but also have rolls and other creative dishes.

We decided to create our own Omakase between the two of us- we ordered:
the Sashimi Omakase for $40
4-5 pairs of Nigiri ($6-8 a pair)
the Beastie Boys ($12 for a pair of Uni/Ankimo/Quail egg goodness!)
a roll ($12)
2 Beers

Everything was delicious and it was very obvious that Elephant Sushi catered to both the true sushi enthusiasts and Americanized-sushi fans alike. We really really enjoyed the nigiri, even though the shari was not as sturdy as traditional sushi bars. The flavors were optimal and the fish were cut with care. Favorites were the Walu, Sake, and Hotate.

Don't come here anticipating a true authentic Japanese experience. Come here with an open mind expecting delicious quality sushi with a fusion twist. The owners are Mongolian but understand what the meaning of a pleasant experience, solid service, and high quality food means! I'm eager to come back!
author: Veronica S.

description: Just too much olive oil and caper on "hon maguro" house special. I couldn't taste subtle flavors of maguro. Nigiri is meh as rice should be properly seasoned and finger pressed. Ankimo was my favorite. Next time I'll go with kaisendon looks yummy and cheaper
author: Jongan S.

description:
WOW! I have found my favorite sushi in San Francisco, perhaps in the Bay Area. I came alone after a looooong day at work. I wanted quick sushi and sake, and happened to wander into this place as it was right off my bus route. As I was alone, I was placed at the very end of the bar. I admit, with my jacket, backpack, and purse, it was a tight squeeze. Elephant Sushi only has a few seats at the bar and they are super close together. Luckily, the couple next to me was super sweet and didn't mind my proximity. 

The service was AMAZING. The women serving me answered my questions and made suggestions based on my preferences. I got a Ya Man roll with the pesto on the side-- I didn't realize the pesto was really more of an infused oil and didn't seem to have cheese (I don't eat cheese). Would get it on the roll next time. The Ya Man was incredible. Seriously the best fish ever. Incredibly fresh and so tasty. I was only planning on having one roll, but enjoyed the Ya Man so much I ordered a Hamachi Truffle. OH my god, this dish. Not a roll, but sashimi with additions. I can't wait to come back! Would only come with one other person because of the set up, but I need to share this place to believe it!
author: Chloe M.

description: We arrived promptly at 6:00 PM and were seated immediately. Because this location does nto take reservations and only holds about 12 people, I would highly recommend arriving around opening time. We ordered the Ya Man, Spicy Hamachi, Spicy Tuna, and Alaska roll. All rolls were very delicious! Our favorites were the Ya Man and Spicy Tuna. It seemed liked the Ya Man was a hit among all of the other customers. The rolls are spicy so be warned - but all around great experience!
author: Mary M.

description: This place is so so good. So so good. Must order: Himalayan ocean trout, caviar toro, and basically everything else.
author: Connie N.

description: This place has great quality of fish but I'm not impressed with it! The rolls are very bland. I'll go just for the sashimi. The girl who worked there was rude. They have their nose in the air service attitude. With the dumb Ass seating and bad service it's definitely not sushi to die for, for me to go back to. No thanks
author: Izzy A.

description: Some of the best sushi I have ever had. The flaming seabass is a MUST get. The place is small and welcoming. Not from the area, but if I'm ever around again I will definitely go back.
author: Caroline I.

description:
What a treat, to be walking up Geary and see this spot, pop in, and find out it's the third location of a local sushi spot that had just opened 4 or 5 days earlier. I'm wary of new places--typically there are lots of kinks to work out--but I was feeling sassy and decided to stop in and roll the dice.

The first thing you'll notice is that it's small. But like, GET OVER IT. Know what? Applebee's and Chili's are plenty big, so if you want room to lay down while you eat, definitely keep on walking and head to the burbs. If you want some place with personality, and a chance to get right up there and personal with your staff and fellow diners, this is the spot. Seriously, it's not for everyone, so if you look in and see that it might be too small for you, don't grab a seat and don't have dinner.

It's just the sushi bar. It's not a place for a group. There aren't tables, let alone large tables. Belly on up and grab a menu. I ordered the Whiteout roll, which is hamachi, avocado, a few tricks inside, and topped with butterfish that's finished with a torch sear and garlic ponzu. I chased that down with a couple of pieces of walu nigiri. I mean, the fish selection was mostly soft, buttery fish. But that fish was definitely soft and buttery. The roll had a great mix of char (the burn, not the Arctic fish) and smooth flavor. And that walu, served with lemon juice, was soft and delicate and had the right taste and profile to make me so happy.

On the scale of authentic to cream cheese, this has found a nice little place in the middle. In fact, they're striking a balance that's kinda hard to achieve. This is not one of those secret places where the chef just gives you his vision of sushi and you eat it pure and clean. Yet it's also not one of those places that's a complete takeover of sushi, with rolls oozing sauces and all kinds of veggies and candy corns sticking out of them. No, it's a place where the fish still reigns supreme, but there are other creative flavors used to enhance them. Both my selections were a perfect example of that. Perhaps sometimes they miss the mark? It's bound to happen, but having a couple of other locations come before them helps me understand why, on their first week of business, they seemed to have it dialed in pretty well.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Loved my experience here! I came right as it opened and the small restaurant at the Tenderloin location has bar seating. The menu had a wide selection and the rolls were truly unique in flavor and each bite left us wanting for more! We had sake with our meal and it was the most perfectly satisfying meal during our stay in San Francisco!
author: Judy W.

description: This was the best Sushi we've ever had - not just in San Francisco - Best EVER!! Seasonings, preparation, flavors blended to perfection!!
author: Denise W.

description:
I mean, sure, the sushi here is delicious and the fish is fresh and all, but there was nothing about this experience that seemed extra special or anything. This is San Francisco: there are plenty of places serving fresh fish. Go here if you want to wait in line for an hour+ to pay 2x what you would anywhere else.

The only benefit of this place over some others is that they had fresh wasabi when I was there. For that, I added a star.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Definitely the best sushi I've had in San Francisco. The guy working the door was super nice, and had some awesome recommendations. The spot is small, and you'll probably have to wait a bit. We did, but just popped across the street to Resolute for a glass of wine and got the phone call our table was ready before we even finished our first glass. 

We were greeted with w free sampler of walu - amazing. Definitely try the whiteout roll. The walu carpaccio was incredible. We actually ordered something they were out of (understandably, it was 20 minutes before they closed on a Sunday). The chef came back with a great alternate, and gave us a free order of scallop sashimi! 

Overall the experience was great. Glad to see more businesses like this opening up in the little nook of the loin.
author: Josh W.

description:
This place is a gem. Just went here for New Year's Eve dinner and got seated within 20 min. There's only room for 5 couples to sit in the space so once it becomes more popular I'm sure it's going to be a crazy long wait. 

Their host/server is so friendly and he brought us hot sake and tea while we waited outside. When we got seated he offered up suggestions and the sushi chef gave us complimentary hamachi sashimi from the starter menu. It. Was. Freaking. Amazing. 

We ordered spicy hamachi, ya man roll, white out, and then the spicy trio sashimi bowl. I'd recommend all of it!!! The spicy trio was a generous size and was an amazing starter to our rolls. We probably could have ordered one bowl each and been full but of course we had more! 

Ya man was our favorite. Can't get over the crispy garlic, oil, and sweet tangy ponzu. I'd order another one if I had room! The white roll was nice and buttery like it says and we also loved the fresh ginger they serve. It really tastes homemade with a strong kick in the face. 

Overall I'd come back not just cause it was deliciously fresh and unique sushi without any gimmicks, but because of the friendly service. They really made us feel like we were friends at their place and everyone at the bar was even chatting about New Years plans. Hope Elephant Sushi does well!!! We'll definitely be back!!!
author: Megan B.

description: Oh people, if this is the BEST sushi you had in your life/San Francisco, I seriously pity you with all my heart. The food is not bad but the portion is quite small & over-priced. There were other people at this place and we all met again at the pizzeria nearby after the meal.
author: Isabella K.

description: This place is very small and very popular so if you don't want to wait in line it's best to get there a few minutes before they open. I can see why it's so popular. The sushi is super fresh, beautifully presented, and appears pretty quickly. I had the spicy hamachi roll and the double albacore roll, both of which were delicious and, together with a Kirin beer, plenty to eat. I plan to be a regular patron!
author: Lou S.

description: Poke bowls are a must try here! The fish is fresh and mixed with complementary ingredients. I would definitely come here more often if it were not located in the TL.
author: Claire W.

description:
My favorite place in the city for rolls!

They use lots of interesting ingredients you wouldn't find at your typical sushi joint, such as scallion, heirloom tomato, fried onion, and various fusions of traditional Japanese sauces. As a result, the rolls are unique in flavor and texture. You can also count on the rolls having generous portions of raw fish - and given that most rolls are in the $10-15 range, I'd say they're great bang-for-buck in San Francisco!

The place is tiny - it only has a single bar for seating, so come in small groups! If you want to go to a proper restaurant with tables and more space, you can go to the original Elephant Sushi in Russian Hill on Hyde.
author: Jeffrey Z.

description: Rated this place for: Location, AMAZING Sushi, staff and atmosphere. Simple menu and the rolls are packed with flavor. Highly recommend.
author: Nicole O.

description: Delicious! It's a tiny place, so be prepared for a wait, but it's worth it. They have the basic rolls and then some creative ones. The fish tasted really fresh and high quality!
author: Stacy H.

description: Went back recently and the food and servers were good but it all seems over-priced, I'm adjusting my star up one because I just returned from Tokyo, and it's bit unfair to compare overly.  But Tokyo is also an expensive city, and their sushi joints were better and much cheaper.  Pet peeve:  Elephant gives you a "tip suggestion" printed on its bill which adds the tax into the calculation, such that their "suggestions" are from about 22% to nearly 35% of your order -- absurd.
author: Steve F.

description: Small, intimate, and fresh. Was in SF on business and chose this place to have dinner solo. The waiters and chefs were all so nice and the fish was fresh. Try the Giants roll, so good!
author: Claudia V.

description: This sushi was so dam good I had to write a review right freakin after.  This place is all about quality but they also give generous portions.  Got a free escolar appetizer that rock my mouth in heaven.  Get the toro, salmon, walu, and white out roll.  THE BEST THING THEY SERVE IS HERE THE WASABI.  Try it and you'll know what I'm talking about.
author: Vince L.

description: This is an amazing place for Japanese food. I ordered one of their bowls (the one with butter fish and albacore), it is really good! I would definitely recommend someone else to order that!
author: James W.

description:
Seldom does a sushi restaurant do so much in such a small place.

To be sure:  this is a tiny place. There is only a sushi bar and no tables.  There are no more that 15 seats, total.  

No reservations.  Come in and add your name to the list.  Have a drink next door and wait to get called.  It could take a while.  

The food is spectacular.  Fresh fish, excellent flavors and an exotic flare.  The owner has 3 restaurants but works in this one.  This is the place to go for sushi.. If you can get in.
author: M S.

description:
I just went to Elephant Sushi. They were completely full, so I put myself on a waitlist, behind a two-top. While I was waiting, another two-top showed up and put themselves on the list behind me. The table ahead of me got called but didn't show up, at which point I expected to be seated. Instead, the two people that showed up after me were seated. At that point I politely informed the restaurant that they could remove my name from the waitlist. I was (and still am) very hungry, and this made for a very disappointing experience that made me feel like I am not at all valued as a customer. 

If this restaurant is so busy that they don't care about people like me, then good for them. I wish my business was so good. However, if they do care about customers like me, they should really find a better way to manager their waitlist.
author: Mike R.

description: This is hands down, my favorite sushi spot in the city. The dishes are very unique and the fish is super fresh. Highly recommend this place for all the sushi lovers!
author: Cecilia N.

description:
I like this place. I've been eyeing it since I made a couple visits to MenSho and debated the line between the two. 

The place is teeny tiny. Like so tiny that if you're near the door, you could get brushed by them closing the door and so tiny that if you're sitting in the corner, you can use the restaurant's pipeline as a backrest. It holds like... 12 people? 

They actually were nice enough to start us off with the walu carpacci on the house and I will say that it was mighty delicious, so it made me really excited for what was to come. 

I had read reviews about their sashimi bowls and was pretty disappointed that this location was only open for dinner, vs lunch at their other locations. So I had to try it here (off menu item - menu on the counter). I got the #1, which was spicy scallop, salmon, butterfish. It was delicious. The walu was marinated in truffle oil and it seeped into the rice in a good way. I thought all their fish was pretty fish. 

We also ordered the yummy pocket, which was ok. I actually thought it was supposed to be fried for some reason, but it was not. The two rolls we got were really good too, the spicy hamachi (some pieces had more lemon than others though - inconsistent) and the ya man roll. 

I'd come back ... but I wish they were open for lunch, so I could come by on a slow day at the office.
author: Jeannie L.

description: Loved everything but the rolls. Omskase was great.  But the rolls had rice that had a bit too much moisture for my taste.  Very small place with only 14 seats.  We were lucky that we only had to wait 5 minutes.
author: Alisha P.

description: A little pricey but the best sushi experience I've had in a long time. The staff was super friendly, and the sushi was very fresh.
author: N V.

description: Don't go here unless you want to ruin the rest of your sushi experiences for the rest of your life (unless you're in Japan). The hunt for just even a comparable Bay Area sushi spot, without paying out the a$$$$, is a serious challenge! Ambience, quality, and service is truly zen here...so kindly go somewhere else for a sake bomb :)
author: eVa J.

description: A line waiting for the doors to open at 6pm, even on a Wednesday! Definitely worth the wait! Anything with salmon is a solid choice. Great music and ambiance.
author: Brian C.

description:
Literally some of the best sushi if not the best sushi I have had in my life all for around $100 for two people.

Go Omakase and you will not be disappointed. I have never tasted fish so fresh and the way they paired each fish with subtle flavours just blew my mind with each bite. 

Will definitely be back.
author: Joe Z.

description:
This is the best sushi restaurant I've been to in SF and that's saying something because I had expected SF to have better sushi but it seems it's a land of sushi mediocrity. This place however, is a real top notch stand out and worth every penny (this is coming from someone who does not believe in paying for ambiance - I pay for food / deliciousness). 

The sashimi fish is very fresh - not fishy tasting at all. For example I rarely eat yellow tail because it's usually fishy but this place the fish was almost sweet. The rolls have unique flavor to them and are sizable. The ya man roll in particular is excellent. They pickle their own ginger and that tastes great as well. I've pretty much loved everything I ate here. It's really really excellent and better than some of those "famous" sushi restaurants that are rated on Yelp.
author: L L.

description: Wow may be the best sushi I've had in SF. Extremely fresh - ordered the Alaskan roll and hamachi nagiri. My friend ordered the spicy tuna chips and dip. Gorgeous presentation and even better taste. Intimate spot with pleasant waiters.
author: Sophie J.

description: I came here because of the high rating.  I got seated right the way around 6:30.  I asked the server to bring me the most  popular dishes. They were great but perhaps I came with high expectation, I just think they are just above the average. The sushi rice were just normal and there were some combinations that don't make sense, like truffle and basil oil on the fatty trouts - it just kills the flavor of the good fish.. If you want some good sushi - try Akiko on Mason.
author: Tom V.

description:
Delicious, great quality sushi
I went on my own so got seated straight away, it's not student budget friendly but screw it- im on holiday!
I had beastie boys - which has sea urchin and quails egg wrapped in seaweed. I've never had anything like it before, and was difficult to eat, but ver tasty
Yummy pocket- nice, I probably wouldn't have again though
Himalayan trout- I got as it has been recommended and it defo lived up to the hype!! Would go back just for the trout. 5 stars
The staff were really kind and attentive
Great place for a date.
author: Ruth P.

description:
Amazing service!
Incredible food!
Awesome quaint atmosphere, great attention from the staff

HIGHLY recommend
author: Jesse K.

description: The uni with quail egg was amazing.  Everything else was good, but not worth the price.  A lot of the rolls were similar in flavor probably due to use of the same sauce.  The restaurant is tiny so be prepared to be sitting right next to another party.
author: Chris T.

description: My absolute most favorite sushi spot in SF! I never have to wait too long at this location. If there is a wait, the staff tells you to grab a drink next door and they would come and let you know when the table is ready! The sushi is fresh and I love the sashimi bowls. Out of all the locations, this is definitely my favorite! Highly Recommend!
author: Natalie C.

description:
came here on Sat night (late) and was able to get a seat relai let quickly. the place is small so it's a bit of a gamble in terms of the wait time. 
the ambiance was modern but not outstanding (esp for this price point).
the main attractions are the appetizers and the house specials. the rolls are good too but the nigiri are a bit disappointing (just raw fish with some wasabi on sushi rice - no special sauce, no searing). the fish is really good and the portions are generous. the flavors are bold which may not be to every sushi amateur's taste (for more subtle flavors see Ijji or Maruya).
author: Ruben K.

description: One of my most favorite sushi spots in SF. The sushi is delicious. Love the creative options on the menu. The staff are really nice! The ambiance is unique. Incredibly small restaurant that includes sushi bar seating only (there are no tables). Only issue is they don't take reservations and because it's such a small establishment, they can only accommodate like 10 people at once (not sure of the exact number of seats but you get my point). Lines, in general, are frustrating but that's what you gotta put up with to eat here. My recommendation is to get there early to ensure you get a seat when they open for dinner.
author: Diana A.

description: Absolutely great sashimi. Would recommend going there for the sashimi and the nigiri as the rolls are very underwhelming.
author: Penny S.

description:
The girls that work there are LIARS don't know how to manage the waiting list. Waited over an hour and they said they would call us when it was ready. Over an hour later we walked over to see how long it would be. The girl met up with us outside after we saw them clearing writing on the clip board and told the couple in line "your table is next after the next people leave" then she shows us the list and is like "we called you and you didn't answer" then when looking at the number, we saw that they very clearly changed it. 

Coincidentally enough, the people that were waiting in line when we got there were telling us how they were dropped on the list and were waiting in line for the second time.
author: Anthony M.

description:
Ya Man, roll in now.
Beastie Boys? Nigiri, please. 
Melts like butter, fish.
author: Nish N.

description:
My neighborhood sushi joint, a must try! 

The staff is very welcoming and attentive. The sushi is as fresh as it can be. 

Tip: come solo or with one other person. It's a cozy restaurant.
author: Y L.

description: Amazing melt in your mouth sushi.  The soy sauce  was slightly sweet which enhanced the flavor of the fish...
author: Marc H.

description:
I've been to Elephant Sushi twice. It's a tiny restaurant, and both times I felt we were being blatantly rushed out. I always try to be conscious of not overstaying at busy restaurants; my friends and I were not even finished with our meal, and the server brought us our bill. Twice! 

I've tried quite a few dishes here. The fish is fresh, I'll give them that, but I found the flavor combinations redundant and not particularly inspired. Nothing really stood out - it was a blur of   buttery fish and mushy rice covered in sauces that were uniformly way too acidic. 

I did like their spicy scallops a lot though, and their uni was on point. Still, not too eager to go back to drop a bunch of cash at this establishment only to be made to feel like a niusance for not scarfing down underwhelming, overpriced sushi fast enough.
author: Andrea O.

description:
I have found my new sushi place!  Delicious, delicious, delicious!

1. Wale is delightful
2. 16 piece sashimi is a must have - we were just two ppl but couldn't help ordering two! Soooooo good!
3. Rainbow roll nice but not a favorite.  Too much avocado took over the fish
4. Himalayan trout was good but I was expecting a touch of kick with Spanish chili in the description.
5. The weak item in my opinion is the Beastie Boy.

Service was pleasant and efficient.

Can't wait to return.
author: Lev E.

description: i went there with my boyfriend. the place was small but i think the sushi is the best sushi i have so far in SF. The red and yellow sushi is my favorite. and they also have a good service. definitely will go again!!!
author: Melisa A.

description:
Great sushi for a really good price.
The place is small so I had to wait a bit but it was well worth it.

Staff is nice and available.
author: Rob R.

description: Really quick service and the music was A+. The wait staff was quick to clear away things and really sweet. We even got an appetizer upon arriving, the recommendation for the Ya Man roll was spot on. Highly recommend trying it!
author: Cherish P.

description:
This new location is super tiny - bar with maybe 10ish seats? Get there when they open and you won't have a problem.

Everything we got was phenomenal:
- Hamachi truffle - complimentary taster at the start of the meal. Perfect balance of flavors
- Whiteout roll - this was the most "traditional/normal" roll we could find on the menu and it did not disappoint
- Himalayan trout - served on a slab of pink sea salt, curing the delicious fish with a salty flavor
- Sashimi bowl - fresh, delicious fish served with rice and a little bit of veggies.

Everything we got was so, so good, but the only thing is that the menu is relatively limited and a lot of the items are pretty fusion-y (pesto, truffle, etc.)
author: Amy Y.

description: Omg this place is incredible!!! I haven't had this good of sushi since living in Japan. Prices are reasonable. Quality is phenomenal. Taste is like an orgasmic party in you mouth. Definitely give this place a try. Love it.
author: Veronica C.

description: Being in SF for only a weekend, one really has to be choosy where one goes for food. Yelp Help to the rescue!!!!  Elephant Sushi has a creative menu and you can't beat the photos on Yelp, right!? I mean, that's what sold me on this place (that and Mensho Tokyo had a 1.5hr wait!). I had the rainbow roll, the king salmon roll and their sea bass/truffle oil bowl. They were all good except I probably would skip the rainbow roll; I'm here to experience a shock to my taste buds when it comes to sushi, and it was just okay. Anyway, the only other thing that I can critique is that one of the seats on the far end (next to the water-main pipe?) is right in the hot sun's rays near sunset (though you can watch your Sushi being prepared from there). We asked the hostess if we could scoot down a seat but the hostess didn't let us because she was planning to sit another couple in the seats next to us. Although she really could have if she wanted to as there were 3 empty seats available, giving us the room to move out from the sun.
author: Linda W.

description:
This location is smaller than the Hyde one but so cute and intimate! All bar seating so going with a large group probably is not a good idea. Had the omakase, spicy trio sashimi, muscle shooters, and the giants roll. Gotta say they were all phenomenal but muscle shooters were bomb! It's a MUST try. You will leave with no ragrets, not even a single letter! (:
Oh, they don't have the $2 sake bomb special here unlike the other location.
author: Rose G.

description: The complementary Walu carpaccio was nice touch and started things off on a very positive tone.  The trout served on a salt block/brick was unique and pretty killer.  Overall good fish, good experience.  Small place but that made it fun.
author: Brian F.

description: Loved this place! Their Sashimi is probably one of the best I've had in the city. Very friendly staff and great service! Totally recommend checking it out :)
author: Paniz K.

description: Really great really tiny sushi place. The reviews others gave are right on -- really unique, different flavor combinations. They gave us 2 pieces of sushi to start as an amuse. They were some of the best bites we have every had. Amazing. Lots of the fish have salt -- really unique. Lots of great flavors. The fish pieces are really generous.
author: Jen G.

description:
That was such a sad place. 

Pros: The quality of food was truely excellent. Their fish was super fresh, good flavor and I wish I could just go back to taste.

Cons: The place is just too small and crowded. Server constantly passing though our back and bumping here and there. Our women server was SO annoying from the beginning. Whole time she was rushing our order and clean them up even though there were NO ONE waiting! 
She even brought our bills before we asked for it. ( I hate that ) And It was nicely divided into 2 bills within our table which we didn't even ask for it. 

That place is not cheap. They charge pretty good amount for what it is. For that, I expect great food, comfortable setting AND great service. They were missing two of them. 
I WOULD NEVER EVER GO BACK THERE. There are many many better places that we can have really nice meal for the amount we paid for. Oh btw, I was so pissed at the end becasue woman server spilled soy sauce all over my sweater at the end just to push my last button. I actually refused to pay. They still charged and gave me $20 cash. Pitty. What am I? Bum?
Awful after taste. Never again.
author: Green Mango Y.

description: Omg i think one of the BEST sushi restaurant's totally hit San Francisco. Ya Man Roll; combination of king salmon, avocado, scallion, fried red onions chip, pesto and ponzu, are melting in my mouth slowly. I dare u to try out this restaurant! So YUMMY
author: Hong L.

description: For such a small space the gods was great! The ambience and music was good. Definitely coming back again
author: Rho G.

description: What can I say? I'm a mayor of this place on swarm. Love the great cuts of fish combined with very yummy and creative ingredients, such as truffle and capers. And they play reggae!!!
author: Olga A.

description: i love everything about this place. i cannot wait to be back, despite the wait times (and as a New Yorker, i categorically hate lines). but, as a New Yorker, i do love the fact that this place is only open 3 hours a night, hehe. i came with a group of 3 and ordered several items. the best thing i had here was the albacore tuna sashimi on Himalayan salt with torched tomatoes (they use a torch to flash "cook" the tomatoes). i've never before had tomatoes and sashimi together and it was such a delicious combination. will definitely be back.
author: Meryam B.

description: Very flavorful sushi with high quality fish! It's very interesting how the chef uses truffle oil and basil to bring out the best flavors in the fish. My favorites were the toro nigiri, spicy scallop, basil salmon, and #1 sashimi bowl. Will definitely come back next time :)
author: Luki S.

description:
Place is tiny. Literally a sushi bar that only fits 12 or so. You can only wait outside on the sidewalk if the place is filled inside. 

I ordered salmon and hamachi nigiri and the white out roll. 

Fish quality is good but rice that isn't seasoned is my biggest pet peeve when it comes to sushi 

If it's empty and you like rolls go ahead try it. 

Other then that pass amateur sushi hour all night another mediocre sushi spot added to SF surprised thy have 2 other locations.
author: Ryan S.

description: Wow! Elephant's Sushi was great. We were visiting from out-of-town, found the restautant listed here on Yelp. Sytopped by around 8pm on a Thursday, about a 20 minute wait (only 12 or so seats). The sushi was fresh and amazing. Definitely going back next visit to S.F.!
author: Sam R.

description: Delicious... loved the ambience and a place where locals go! The staff and service was awesome. I can't wait to go again.
author: Sidney H.

description: The sushi is amazing! Rainbow roll is delicious and the sea bass sashimi is bomb!! Really pleasant atmosphere
author: Anna Z.

description:
Amazingly fresh and delicious sushi prepared by super friendly dudes. 
LOVED THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: EJ P.

description:
One od the best sushi places in the city! And so close to my place. BUT there are few things I don't like about the business itself. 
1. Super tiny facility. Therefore long waiting lines. May last up to 2 hours. 
2. They close very early. Looks like they operate just for 3-4 hours, dinner time.
3. They closed on Monday and Tuesday. 
To the management: Guys, we love you so much, please expand your hours of operation!!
author: Zarina M.

description:
Elephant Sushi,

I had your Sushi;

Your Albacore Tataki served on a pink Himalayan salt rock; and

Your sashimi bowls.

And now I am speechless.
author: Loubna M.

description: This is the best sushi I've ever had. I had the Ya Man, the White Out and the Fish N Chips. Solid.
author: Wendy H.

description: OMG.  So good!!  No, sooo great.  The white out roll.  Wooo-hooo.  Himalayan trout is  a fav.  Small place, so not everyone in your party may be able to join you, but everyone who joins you will love it.
author: Jon Y.

description: Feeling like sushi in San Francisco, food is great but came in and heard Reggae music (DON'T GET ME WRONG I LOVE REGGAE MUCIC BUT IN A JAPANESE  RESTAURANT?)  also our waitress was a little   slow in the head. On a positive note, this was the best sushi I have ever tasted!
author: Rose C.

description: One of the more creative sushi restaurants I've been to.  It's a small place so get there early or expect a brief wait. If there's a wait, there are fantastic cocktail bars nearby - Px and Rye are both recommended. So have a quick drink while waiting for a seat for some fantastic sushi!
author: Sean G.

description: In SF for conference, found this little place 3 mins walk from hotel.  The place is amazing with friendly services and great sushi!  The taste is in the right place that make you feel like in Japan!  Very happy.
author: Mike D.

description: My favorite sushi place! And probably my favorite restaurant. The fish is so good and the styles of some of the dishes are so interesting. One of my favorites is the Himalayan trout on a salt block! Very interesting and so good. I love that the wait here is never that bad which is surprising for how good it is! The only thing is that the place is small so you can't go with big groups or hang out that long... but it's ok since it's still totally worth it!
author: Renee R.

description:
Food:

Some of the best, freshest sushi my wife and I have ever had. We're pretty picky about our sushi, and we were impressed. Literally everything we tried was excellent. They pickle their own ginger too, and it's very good. 

Atmosphere:

It bears mentioning that this is a sushi _bar_. There is no restaurant style seating, which leads me to the one downside... Only about 12 patrons at a time fit (tightly), in the room, and this is apparently a pretty popular spot, so be prepared for a wait. It was about a half hour for us on a Thursday night. On the other hand, they'll call your cellphone when they're almost ready for you, and the Rx Bar right next door is an awesome place to grab a drink and wait. 

Service 

The entire staff is super friendly, and happy to make recommendations if you're not sure what you'd like to try.
author: Steve L.

description: So this place has no tables. Just a small sushi bar. Food might be good. Who knows? No tables is a show stopper for me. Wish I'd have known before waiting hour for them to open.
author: Seth K.

description: Saturday, 6:30PM, 20 minute wait outside (no waiting room), poorly conditioned place with door creating a draft - but OK, I can deal that if the food is good. Takes them a while to even take my order.  They are out of two out of five things I tried to order (and the waitress did not even bother to tell me about one of them until the very end). Rice in nigiri was warm (actually, hot), falling apart, and poorly shaped, like in a bad Chinese restaurant. Rolls were falling apart as well. Green tea was brought so hot that it was impossible to even hold the cup - definitely not even close to the appropriate temperature, and the waitress had to be begged for refills.  I was so amused by the pretentious check that suggested - for my convenience! - tip amounts that ranged from 20 to 30%.  Really, 30%? The menu and concept has promise, but, boy, this has to be executed well.
author: Vlad D.

description: For about $65 I had enough (grade-A) sashimi to feel satiated (16 for $40 - huge mouth-watering pieces) and shared a premium bottle of sake.  Seriously, I've been to places that would take one piece of sashimi from here and make it 7 pieces at their own restaurant.  They are big.  And the best I've had (admittedly have never been to any $600-2,000 person places, but have spent more than $60 and gotten less many times before!).  Truly memorable experience.  I believe we were there on a Thursday - not sure when shipments are
author: Mike J.

description: Great sushi place, food was really good and customer service excellent. Restaurant was full but they called me as soon as seats were available.
author: Alex R.

description: There's no tables, just waiting in line to sit at the bar. We had shaved truffle slices over albacore for an appetizer, torro and two rolls. It was delicious and I'll definitely be back.
author: Nathan B.

description: The place is smaller than a Tokyo apartment but the food is worth the temporary claustrophobia. Items to order include the Ankimo nigiri, scallop and tuna roll, salmon roll, uni nigiri is oceany and rich. The prices aren't much higher than Sanraku but the food and value are much better. Try it out and you'll see for yourself.
author: N A.

description: Great little sushi spot! I think the service could b little more warm and friendly. But beyond that some of the best sushi I've ever had. Outstanding!
author: Liz D.

description: Thumb up for the food! Tiny place but was really worth the trip and wait (30min) for dinner.
author: Yibang C.

description: The reviews of this place were so good that I had to venture out with my bf to try it on a rainy day. Disclaimer, I have been to their other location as it's right next to my office. First of all, it was absolutely pouring rain outside, and upon entering the restaurant the waitress asked us to step outside of it and wait outside. We were made to wait outside for 5 min in the pouring rain. I never experienced this before. I get the restaurant was small but my bf and I are skinny and don't take up that much room. I felt embarrassed in front of my bf because we came here under my suggestion. Minus one star for that. Upon getting in, there was no room to store our coats. The sashimi bowls, the most cost effective option that I enjoyed at the other location, was completely arbitrarily $6 more!! The portion and quality was close to the same. The food itself tastes good, 4 stars, but I needed to deduct another star for the arbitrary price difference. :/
author: Crystal Y.

description: Overpriced for the quality. Salmon was terrible (felt like I was gnawing on the pieces they gave us). Butterfish was ok. $14 glass of white wine no good. The sashimi bowl was decent and probably only item I'd get again, but, then again, I won't be coming back, much better sushi places out there for your buck!
author: Stephen P.

description: Try the Ya Man Roll and White Out roll! They are delicious. Himalayan trout is also really great. The hot sake is good price but they are just so so. One surprise is their house made ginger, it got an ice kick.
author: Ran L.

description: Amazing!!!!!!!! Notice that I love sushi (see other reviews lol) and this place rocks. Awesome service and good prices given the quality. Will be back for sure. Try the Ya Man Roll !!!!!!!!!!!
author: Lilly M.

description: Fantastic! Melt in your mouth buttery fresh and interesting. Worth the wait! Worth every penny.
author: Rebecca F.

description: The service was great! However, the sushi was just okay. I presume more people come here for the rolls though? I didn't order any. I usually order nigiri to get an idea of the quality of the fish. The complimentary sample of their walu carpaccio was tasty. I also liked the sake, ocean trout, hamachi and seabass nigiri. However, the hotate nigiri came out ice cold and was over salted. One huge issue I had was that there was too much rice in the nigiri!!! Please consider preparing your nigiri with just a little bit less rice so it doesn't overwhelm the fish. The place is small so I recommend showing up early, especially before 8:30pm.
author: Q C.

description: Everything was so fresh and super delicious. We tried mussel shooter with quail egg from appetizing part, it melted in our mouths! Yes, it was that delicious. Other things we ordered from house specials and rolls were all very fresh and tasty. Staffs were super friendly and chefs were incredibly.  They have 2 other locations, and both are really popular. U have to line up for dine. Seats are limited, so better rush! :)
author: Stacy U.

description: Absolutely worthy of 5 stars. Fantastic service, fantastic fish quality, and fantastic prices relative to that quality. SO good!
author: Niall M.

description: The service and food was absolutely amazing. The servers were so polite and as soon as we sat down try brought a free appetizer for our party. The prices were also very reasonable.
author: Blue J.

description: Loved Elephant Sushi! Small little place, about a 30 minute wait in which we just walked across the street to get some awesome drinks first. Very great service and delicious sushi!
author: Vanna C.

description: I was only able to sample a few things, as the snapper with jalapeno was so good I had to get it twice in the same meal.  Small place with only sushi counter seats which is the only place you should ever sit at when eating sushi.  In response to Nicole's review below:  buttery is the exact description you give to something that melts in your mouth and pesto is precisely basil with olive oil so I think her point reductions were entirely unjust. GO and enjoy
author: Christopher M.

description: Sigh....if only this place did not require such a ridiculous wait!! It is clear just by looking at the sushi that the ingredients are fresh and we really appreciated both the atmosphere of the restaurant and the quality of the food. However, parking in this area around dinner is also a headache so plan ahead!
author: Christina H.

description: This is the best sushi I have ever had. Affordable, stylish, surprising and exquisitely delicious. The butter fish was my favourite.
author: Owen H.

description: Amazing sushi! Great service. Cute and quaint so only take a great friend or sister. Had the salmon roll. Mind blown!
author: Natalie D.

description:
Best Sushi me and everyone in my party have ever eaten. 

This place is TINY. About 12-14 seats total in the whole place. When we showed up we sat outside and decided it was too small and didn't want to take the chance of it not being great so we started calling other places around the city. We had no luck as everywhere else had an hour or more wait so at the last second we sat down to give it a shot. GREAT decision. 

Before we knew it there was about 15 people standing outside waiting to get in for 45+ minutes. Service was amazing, friendly chefs that called us by name based on our reservation, food was INCREDIBLE. We ordered 10+ rolls between the 4 of us. Great prices. 

This will be a spot I return to every time I'm in the city.
author: Richie S.

description: I just ate here tonight with a date.  Wow, this place is awesome.  The hamachi and maguro melted in my mouth, and had a sweet taste to it.  This is good stuff folks. The rolls were great too.  The customer service was excellent.  Really friendly servers and chefs.  Five stars all the way.  The place is small however. (Think Jiro Dreams of Sushi)  It might be nice to have somewhere to hang coats/jackets.  They don't take reservations, so if there's a wait, you might want to put your name down, then go to a nearby cafe and have them call you when your seats open up.  The restaurant is too small to wait inside of and it was in the 40s outside so we waited at the cafe Joy's Place a couple blocks away at 611 Post St, it's open until midnight.  After dinner we drove up to Coit Tower (Ten minute drive) and watched the lights on the Bay Bridge.  :)
author: Mike A.

description:
Tamir (owner) is the best! Sushi is so fresh and delightful always. This is my neighborhood place to go and given that it's small the waitress and staff are always so warming. 

Paula
author: P A.

description: Great service! The host was so smiley and friendly and even slid us ahead of line because we waited right outside. Service was quick and helpful! Sushi tasted really fresh, great options for a good price for the quality. Bathroom was cute and sanitary! Only con, really small so expect a wait!
author: Kendra B.

description: Had to wait for a bit but it was so good. The food was on key. Had the bestie boys x 2 times. Ankimo. White out roll. Hamachi Truffle and sake salmon. Food was good.
author: Mike N.

description: Best meal I've had in San Francisco so far! Amazing service and the food was so fresh and delicious.
author: Sarah M.

description: Fantastic sushi! Small restaurant so I followed other Yelp recommendations and arrived 15 minutes before they opened. I got a seat right away but if I didn't arrive when I did, the second seating was about 7PM.  I highly recommend them!
author: Eddie L.

description: I live in Arizona and every time I'm in the city I make sure I visit either location for Elephant Sushi. Its tough to pick one specific dish that makes this place 5 stars.  It would be easier to say that you should continue to come here until you have had them all.
author: J R.

description: This place is AMAZING! The servers were super nice and attentive. The food was beyond fresh and oh-so tasty. You can really tell that attention has been paid to every little detail, including the house made ginger and soy sauce. And after everything the bill was very reasonable. I will be back soon and will absolutely recommend this place.
author: Brian W.

description: Very good sushi, but a very small restaurant. There is only a sushi bar, no tables. If you can get past this aspect, you will have a great sushi dinner. They keep a wait list, and will call you when your spot at the bar is available. The Blue Fin bites are great. I thought the "chips and dip" we're good, but a little heavy on the sauce. I would rate them 4.5 stars,but Yelp won't let me. Give them a shot.
author: Matt S.

description: The TL area is getting some great influx of new restaurants recently and this is one of them. The first thing to note is that the restaurant is very small. They only have seats for 11 people, so I would recommend planning accordingly. The menu has a great assortment of small plates, rolls, and appetizers. I wasn't feeling too hungry so I ordered the mussel shooters. The dish came with 6 mussels on the plate and I think it came out to about ~$12. My friend ordered a few vegetarian rolls and reported that they were also very good. In total, we only spent about $30 which is pretty standard for any sushi restaurant. We however did not order the pricier rolls/dishes on the menu. I thought it was worth it considering the quality of the ingredients compared to other Japanese places nearby (ie. Sanraku and Ryokos). The quality of the ingredients here is something to be noted; everything tasted really clean and fresh. I also thought the setup of the restaurant, while small, felt authentic to a small sushi bar you might see if you visited Japan. All in all, a great experience.
author: Rebecca D.

description: Modern Interpretation of Sushi. Awesome. I had Walu Carpaccio, Spicy Trio Sashimi Bowl, and Yummy Pocket. Was here shortly after it opened at 18:00 on a Sunday. An hour later there was already a 15 minute wait.
author: David A.

description: Had sea bass sashimi, sashimi bowl and spicy tuna roll. Great flavors, and fresh fish. Highly recommend. Not a lot of seating but was great for a single in town.
author: Nathanael T.

description: Good sushi, tiny location with counter seating only. Very intimate but might not be for everyone if you need personal space.
author: L D.

description: I have been wanting to try this place ever since a friend posted a picture of The Beastie Boys on her Facebook page. Been obsessing about The Beasties Boys for awhile now. Finally, I got my opportunity to go. I chose the Geary location because it was close to work. I walked in and boy is this place tiny! There's only a sushi bar with seating for 11 people. So, yeah it was little cramp. I ordered Beastie Boys, White Out Roll, Walu and Monkfish Liver Nigiri. So, the first thing that comes out is the Hamachi Nigiri. I told the waitress I didn't order this, but I will take it. It was delicious! The Walu and Monkfish was underwhelming. I won't be ordering those two again. The White Out Roll was super good. Excellent texture and flavor. I couldn't have chosen a better roll. Finally the BEASTIES BOYS. Ah yes...UNI. I get it now. Never really cared for uni in the past but damn the uni here was divine. And to add the quail egg on top and all the other good bits they put in it? Genius.  I could've eaten another order or two but I had to be an adult and show some self control. Service was quick. Food was delish. I knocked off a star because there was a basic nigiri I was craving that I couldn't get here. Tobiko and quail egg. I asked for it, but they couldn't provide.  Overall, I would go back and order the Beastie Boys and try other stuff off the menu. I'd even go back and order nothing but the Beastie Boys.
author: Aimey T.

description: Um this has been the best sushi place I've been to all year! The sushi was so fresh and delicious, and the music they were playing was fun! Yes it's small but the host let us wait at the bar next door and personally went and got us when our spots were ready! Definitely 5+ stars! I Will be back!
author: Angie S.
